body:
Wit h PC and monitor chosen i'm looking for a keyboard - mechanical. Done a lot of research so please don't try and give me a lecture on the basics.
I just want to know what switch you prefer, why and what board you have. Reccomend me any keyboard under $100 / £70 pounds cheaper is better for me ;) 

Also on a side note if anyone can find me cheap windows i'll lvoe you.

replies.body:
A 100$ budget is hard to work with. Lucky for you, I just got this email from MassDrop ;D

https://www.massdrop.com/buy/e-element-rgb-keyboard?referer=YXCGFU&mode=guest_open&utm_source=Sailth...

Also, I like Logitech's Romer-Gs the best, but that keyboard is 200$. As for Cherry, I like Blues the best.
I have a CM Storm Devestator keyboard, which is not mechanical.

The keyboard I linked you to has Cherry MC copies, but people say it's a lot better than Kaihl (Razer). It also has a aluminum back plate and more RGB color options than most RGB keyboards out there.
For 100$, you really can't go wrong xd.
replies.body_tagged:

I have a CM Storm Devestator keyboard, which is not mechanical.

The keyboard I linked you to has Cherry MC copies, but people say it's a lot better than Kaihl (Razer). It also has a aluminum back plate and more RGB color options than most RGB keyboards out there.
For 100$, you really can't go wrong xd.

replies.body:
I got it almost half price before you start ranting at me. ^.^
It keys are slightly loud, but still acceptable and extremely clicky. I use all the macro keys (not for pvp don't worry) :P. The colour is a nice feel and works great for me!

Try to get a good deal (under £100).
